Key Strengths: The initial term of 36 months aligns with best practices.
Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are well-defined with specific performance guarantees.
Indemnification provisions are present and cover necessary scenarios.
Critical Weaknesses: Unclear early termination fee provisions could lead to disputes.
Limitation of liability is capped at $100,000, which may be insufficient for high-value contracts.
Confidentiality provisions could be strengthened to ensure better protection.
Priority Recommendations: Clarify early termination fee calculations to ensure fairness.
Consider increasing the limitation of liability cap to better align with industry standards.
Enhance confidentiality clauses to provide more robust protections.

Implementation Priorities: Address high-priority concerns first, followed by medium and low-priority items.
